What information does the `getnettotals` command in Verus provide?

The `getnettotals` command in Verus returns an object containing three pieces of information: `totalbytesrecv` (the total number of bytes received), `totalbytessent` (the total number of bytes sent), and `timemillis` (the total CPU time).

#### Result:
```json
{
 "totalbytesrecv": n,  (numeric) Total bytes received
 "totalbytessent": n,  (numeric) Total bytes sent
 "timemillis": t    (numeric) Total cpu time
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getnettotals
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnettotals", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getnetworkinfo`
Returns an object containing various state info regarding P2P networking.
How can I use the `getnettotals` command in Verus?

You can use the `getnettotals` command in Verus by running `verus getnettotals` in the command line or by using a JSON-RPC request, such as `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnettotals", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`.

#### Result:
```json
{
 "totalbytesrecv": n,  (numeric) Total bytes received
 "totalbytessent": n,  (numeric) Total bytes sent
 "timemillis": t    (numeric) Total cpu time
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getnettotals
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnettotals", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getnetworkinfo`
Returns an object containing various state info regarding P2P networking.
What is the purpose of the `getnetworkinfo` command in Verus?

The `getnetworkinfo` command in Verus returns an object containing various state information regarding P2P networking. This command provides a way to get information about the current state of the network.

#### Result:
```json
{
 "totalbytesrecv": n,  (numeric) Total bytes received
 "totalbytessent": n,  (numeric) Total bytes sent
 "timemillis": t    (numeric) Total cpu time
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getnettotals
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getnettotals", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```### `getnetworkinfo`
Returns an object containing various state info regarding P2P networking.
